Portal is a minimalist masterpiece that strips gaming down to it's bare bones and rebuilds everything we know about gaming. Despite it's short runtime and simple premise, Portal has your mind going a mile a minute wondering how to solve it, where is everyone, who wrote the scribblings on the wall, how does Half-Life fit in to all this, and many other questions. I think that very reason it why Portal, despite only having two canonical games, a comic, and an ARG has stood the test of time.

Portal is a game with many mechanics, lots of twists and turns, and horrible betrayals. I would recommend waiting for this to go on sale, because the game is shorter then most. Probably a lot harder for younger audiences but still playable. The game itself is very fun and interactive, and it really makes you use your mind. Definitely worth the play.
A very cool puzzle game with a lonely and dark feel to it, it's nostalgic.

The additional challenges give you even more challenging stuff to do after finishing the game.

13年前，我们花几十块在泛着白色光晕的实验室中和着专门作曲的StillAlive音乐与蠢萌可爱又腹黑的GlaDOS探寻爱与人工智能的真理。
13年后，我们在高度同质化的大部分内容被审查掉的画质甚至不如以往的圈钱氪金垃圾游戏中和着公共领域的口水歌与千篇一律的自走软色情形象挥霍上千。
我们缺什么？
我们缺什么？
[h1]我们缺什么？[/h1]
中国五千年历史不乏剑与魔法的神话，不乏遥望星空的幻想，不乏数不清的各类仙神，不乏传奇性的历史神话，不乏心怀天下的各类文人墨客，不乏是非成败，成王败寇：五千年，五千年，[b]什么都有！[/b]
我们缺少的是开明不把游戏当作电子毒品的老一辈长辈，不一拍脑袋到处折腾的领导，不见到风吹草动就一棒子打死的审核者，不到处闹事的屑家长，不因玩游戏把孩子打骨折的父母，不把游戏当成圈钱工具的厂商

由此可见，腾讯网易不是个东西还有广电总局
a ideia desse jogo é incrivelmente interessante e inovadora

Um Ótimo jogo, bem curto então dá para finalizar ele em um dia se você quiser, puzzles bem divertidos e tals, um game que realmente merece seu reconhecimento além de ter abrido portas para o "Portal 2" o qual é muito melhor. Enfim, é um ótimo jogo que vale seu preço principalmente quando estiver em promoção, eu comprei na Summer Sale de 2020 e finalizei em um dia, o tempo passou rápido.

 Pode comprar, não vai se arrepender.

A staple to Valve and to gaming itself, Portal is an amazing puzzle game with some fun quirks. A definite must buy.

Bueno, después de jugar poco mas de 2 horas terminé Portal (podría haber sido un poco menos, pero me entretuve con algunos logros). Ya lo había completado allá por el 2007 cuando salió pero fue usando un parche en el ojo, y tenía que hacerlo al menos una vez de buena manera.  
Solo puedo decir que es un buen juego, la mecánica de los portales para resolver puzles fue todo un hallazgo por parte de Valve en aquellos tiempos. Puede saber a poco por su corta duración, pero si alguien se quedó con ganas puede intentar completar los desafíos y los logros, que darán algunas horas más de juego.
Muy recomendable si logras encontrarlo en una rebaja junto con su secuela, Portal 2, ya que en ella se mejora la jugabilidad y se amplía la historia.
(Y un pequeño spoiler que me resultó curioso: [spoiler] en el enfrentamiento final, no empieces la pelea arrojando el primer núcleo al incinerador. Si no lo haces GLaDOS comenzará a decir tonterías porque no das el siguiente paso, e incluso intentará usar psicología inversa y es bastante gracioso de oir :P [/spoiler] )

A arte de pensar nesse jogo é uma coisa que te deixa meio estressado as vezes e depois que você realmente percebe como resolve o puzzle se sente até um inutil. Mas depois quando a dificuldade aumenta e você tem que resolver sob pressão, acaba se tornando mais divertido :D

Finally was able to play this and I loved it! The pace and difficulty of the "tests" flowed pretty well and I do admit that a couple of areas stumped me for a little while. This game is a treat and makes you think outside the box in unique ways that I'm sure will differ depending on others' play styles. I adored the music and GLaDOS's final song was supremely satisfying (I can't get the song out of my head!). The only issue I had related to the Loading Screens that sometimes seemed to appear out of nowhere, interrupting my immersion in the game. Aside from that, all good things. I would definitely recommend this to people of all ages. Good clean fun and GLaDOS's sarcasm was funny AF. Take advantage of the Summer Sale if you can! I was able to get the Portal/Portal 2 combo for about $3. Happy hunting! =)

Está bueno pero el modo historia es demasiado corto. Aún así, este juego es completamente necesario para que Portal 2 tenga un efecto nostálgico y la experiencia de revisitar el complejo Aperture Science a través del tiempo sea excepcional.

Aún así, la historia de Portal (1) es bastante buena por sí misma, aún así dure un aproximado de 5 horas.

It's been at least a few years since I finished and last played Portal but I have the following to say about it:

It was definitely innovative for its time. I didn't find a single bug while playing (unless if you count wonky physics between portals and moving targets, which very rarely occured). Overall the puzzles were great fun and not impossibly hard by any stretch. The narrative is playful and GLaDOS is one of the most iconic characters/villains in any game ever. Her obvious lack of energy in her jokes really makes you feel like a test subject locked by a self-aware evil AI that wants to keep testing forever. The physics are really fun to play with, and a lot of puzzles can be solved slightly differently if you take advantage of that. The story progression isn't groundbreaking but it's definitely interesting and I really anticipated to see what the next thing to piss GLaDOS off would be.

The visuals are amazing. This does NOT look like a 2007 game. It looks like it was made at least after 2010. There are games that come out even today that don't look this good (but of course not as well-funded as Valve's games). The soundtrack didn't seem that memorable except for the legendary ending performance. All in all, just a great game that was leagues ahead of its time, 9/10.
